title: Ticket #3816: Have example use cases
description:
Note: I'm not sure whether this is something that should be in the Wiki or the actual HTCondor manual.

Anyhow, this comes out of a discussion from a meeting today with Miron and people from BMRB (this is a request from Miron).

Miron wants to add a bunch of uses case examples that we can point people at. These would have details of how people got their particular application running on HTCondor. An example might be, "I have a bunch of analysis jobs that each take 48 hours to run, and I want to run 1000 of them". So details would be stuff like, "how did they actually get their jobs to run on HTCondor at all"; "how did the break the 48 hour chunks up into smaller pieces"; "how big were the input and output files, and how did they deal with them"; "how did the fit the whole thing into some kind of DAG", 'here's a problem to watch out for", etc., etc.

The goal would be to eventually have a number of these, each representing a fairly common case, that we could point a new HTCondor user to and say, "Okay, here's an example of how someone did something similar to your use case."

I think Miron sees these being developed by talking to actual HTCondor users and finding out what they had to do to get their stuff to run.
